div.p:
Students manage assignments and grades
by logging in to the CSIU Student Information System. Parents are required to do a one-time registration to gain access to all student assignments and grades on the CSIU Parent Portal.

a.span: 4-20-20 – Message from Superintendent, Mr. Stellar Regarding Continuity of Education at MCASD

strong.span: NEW: Download 2019-20 Continuity of Education Student Handbook

div.strong: How to Log-in to Teacher Websites

div.div: Log in to your school email account. Your default password is your student ID number. You are required to change it the first time you log in. You can find the links and codes to your classes on the School Closure Resource Site or you can contact your teacher to add/invite you directly.

div.p: Thurs. April 23rd @ 6:00 pm – PHEAA Webinar on “Understanding the Financial Aid Process – For more info – Registration Page

strong.span:
MCASD Continuity of Education Plans
Updated 4-9-2020

div.p: 4-22-20 The Class of 2023’s Rohrbach’s fundraiser will be available for pickup on Thursday, April 23rd in the high school parking lot. The pick up time will be from 4pm- 7pm. If you are unable to make it to the pickup please contact class advisors Miss Danilowicz or Mr. Monger.

p.br: Reminder that, beginning today, MCASD will begin M-W-F only lunch and next day breakfast distribution. Children will still get meals for everyday, but they will only be distributed M-W-F. Members of the administration will continue delivering, and food service workers will continue distribution at MCAES.

div.p: The GSV United Way is sponsoring a cloth mask giveaway on Saturday, April 25, 12-2 pm at the Brady Fire Co.

With Governor Wolf’s declaration that schools are now closed until the end of the academic year, we know you have many questions – continuing our students’ education, the Prom, Class Night, Graduation, National Honor Society Inductions, sports, the School Musical- the list goes on and on. Please understand that we are working hard to do the best we can for our students, and we will have information coming soon.

3-31-20 Service Electric Cablevision is now providing FREE INTERNET SERVICE for 90 days to all students & teachers who do not already subscribe to SECV Internet or have not had the service within the last 60 days. Call SECV at 877-955-7328 for more details.

3-27-20 Our administration, faculty, and staff have been meeting virtually over the course of the last few weeks, and we are continuing with plans to provide continuity of education for all of our students. Mount Carmel Area faculty, aides, and support staff will continue to provide Review and Enrichment activities during the closure, and teachers and aides will be available to work with students and answer questions online, via email, and on the phone whenever possible. Please check the District’s website and individual teachers’ sites for updated information. If anyone does not have access to online resources, paper copies can be made available for you – just contact your Principal, the Special Education Department, or call the school at 570-339-1500 and follow the prompts.
Please visit the District’s Facebook Page and main website regularly for updates.
Center for Disease Control and Prevention COVID-19

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left

div.p: Survey for Junior/ Senior High School Families. Please take a moment to take this short survey.

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_1 et_clickable et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top

div.p: Hello MCA Students and Parents,

A few notes to think about while you are at home. Your teachers have been very busy creating Google Classrooms, and gathering materials to keep you busy. Check out our new webpage for tons of activities to keep you from being bored. All of these resources are completely optional. We hope that you will find them of value and keep your mind active. We miss all of you and hope to see you very soon. If you have any questions please email us. Please note that planned instruction introducing new learning content begins on Mon., April 27th.

Mrs. Varano – varanol@mca.k12.pa.us
Mr. Cheddar – cheddarp@mca.k12.pa.us

Be the best you can be.
MCA PROUD
GO BIG RED
STAY SAFE!
Mrs. Varano & Mr. Cheddar

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_2 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top

p.b: MCASD began providing student lunches and breakfasts (breakfast for the following day), March 17. The meals can be picked up at the cafeteria lobby of Mount Carmel Area Elementary between the hours of 10:30 AM – 12:30 PM. Students must be present to get a meal, and all children that reside in the district qualify up to age 18. If the students are 18 years old, but they are an MCA student, they qualify, as well. Again, students must be present to get a meal.

div.p: Also, Buddy Bags will continue to be distributed every Friday between the hours of 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM. The pick up location for all Buddy Bags will be the main entrance of our Jr.-Sr. High School. Students are not permitted in the buildings to pick up items – if there is an emergency situation, please call the school.

Free school lunch & next-day breakfasts will continue M-W-F. Monday and Wednesday lunches with be a double to cover non-delivery days. We are expanding our delivery to surrounding communities at the following locations:
Van #1:
Van #2:

ul.li: Kulpmont Holy Angels Church rear parking lot: 10:55-11:10 am

div.p: Mount Carmel Area Administrators will deliver the lunches to the surrounding communities.

The Kulpmont Sportsmen Association, in conjunction with the West End Fire Co., will continue to provide lunch to all students M-F at the West End Fire Co., 12:00 noon-1:00 pm. Buddy Bag distribution will continue every Friday. The bags will be distributed at the main entrance of the JSHS and at the West End Fire Co. in Kulpmont from 10:30 am to 12:30 pm.
Mr. Stellar

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_3 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top

div.h4: Submit Your Pictures to Complete the 2020 Carmelite Yearbook

div.p: Submit your pictures by email to Mrs. Sheehe

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_4 et_clickable et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top

h4.a: Complete the 2020 Census Online in Minutes

p.span: The Census controls how much federal funding comes to our area, including to the Mount Carmel Area School District. It takes only a few minutes, but the impact is very important!

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_5 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_left

div.p: Support the Mount Carmel Area School District through your tax deductible contribution to the Mount Carmel Area Education Foundation. Donations can be in honor or in memory of someone and designated to any worthy cause to help bridge the gap between available funding and needs of the MCA students and staff. Thank you for your support.

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_6 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top

div.p: The Mount Carmel Area School District continues to spearhead a fundraising campaign in an attempt to help fund the “Tornado Buddy Bag” program for the 2020-2021 school year. Find out more information and how you can help MCA students succeed.
Donations to help support the program can made made to the Mount Carmel Area Education Foundation.

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_7 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top

img.alt: Proposed center display of bricks at Silver Bowl South End Zone

h5.a: Purchase your brick or sign today!

div.p:
The Mount Carmel Area School District has begun a Red Tornado Legacy Brick Project at the MCA Silver Bowl. All proceeds will go to the general upkeep of the stadium. The next order due date is May 1, 2020.
Contact the Jr./Sr. High Principal office for more information. Go Big Red!

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_8 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top

p.span: The foundation has set a goal to raise the necessary funds to repair or replace the planetarium in the Mount Carmel Area High School. If you would like to donate to the cause or any other of our current initiatives, you can do so on our
. Please indicate for what project you would like your donation to be used.

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_9 et_clickable et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top

p.span: In the spring of 2019, Mount Carmel Area School District launched an unprecedented three-year fundraising initiative — to raise $ 1 million to restore and update Mount Carmel Area’s famed Silver Bowl Stadium. The main fundraising effort will go towards the installation of a new all-weather field.
